message.content:
<<<api>>>: Collections.min, Collections.max
<<<code>>>: 
Entry minEntry = Collections.min(test, new Comparator<Entry>() {
    @Override
    public int compare(Entry entry1, Entry entry2) {
        return Float.compare(entry1.getValue(), entry2.getValue());
    }
});

Entry maxEntry = Collections.max(test, new Comparator<Entry>() {
    @Override
    public int compare(Entry entry1, Entry entry2) {
        return Float.compare(entry1.getValue(), entry2.getValue());
    }
});

float minValue = minEntry.getValue();
float maxValue = maxEntry.getValue();
<<<explanation>>>: The Collections.min and Collections.max methods require a Comparator to compare the elements in the ArrayList. In this case, you can create a custom Comparator that compares the values of the Entry objects. The compare method should return a negative value if the first entry is smaller, a positive value if the first entry is larger, and 0 if they are equal. Then, you can use the min and max methods to find the minimum and maximum Entry objects. Finally, you can retrieve the values from the Entry objects using the getValue method.
